Class LSNode

  • java.lang.Object
    • LSNode

  • public class LSNode
extends java.lang.Object

    LSNode

    LS Link class that acts as a single LS packet on the network.

    It does the Following:

    1. Initiates a LS Link from a settings file with a local network graph with its adjacent links
    2. Has the ability to expand its topology by recieving other topologies from other LS links instances or topology instances
    3. Prints the shortest path from its LS link to all other connected LS links in the network that have been known
    Created by Zack Zaiter (Abdulrahman) & Ryan Castiglione on 11/16/2017.
    Since:
    11/16/2017
    Author:
    Zack Zaiter (Abdulrahman) & Ryan Castiglione.

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LSNode(java.lang.String fileName)
      The class constructor that will Initiates a LS Link from a settings file with a local network graph with its adjacent links The file has to be of the following format: LSNode ID LSNode Server Port number of nodes number of edges Example: 0 30000 2 1 30001 2 30002 2 0 1 1 0 2 6

        LSNode(java.lang.String fileName)
throws java.lang.Exception
        The class constructor that will Initiates a LS Link from a settings file with a local network graph with its adjacent links The file has to be of the following format: LSNode ID LSNode Server Port number of nodes number of edges Example: 0 30000 2 1 30001 2 30002 2 0 1 1 0 2 6
        Parameters:
        fileName - The file name of the file that contains the LS packet settings.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - when the LSNode fails to initiate from a settings file
